educations.schoolName: Harvard University, John F. Kennedy School of Government

educations.degree: Master in Management of Information Technology
educations.schoolName: University of Virginia - McIntire School of Commerce

headline: Director of Workforce and Enterprise Operations Acquisition Division
summary: An innovative, customer-focused executive leader with an enterprise-wide, strategic approach to procurement. With Exceptional internal and external customer management skills, with the ability to inspire customer confidence through attentive service and efficient problem-solving. Possesses keen analytical skills dedicated to the development of quality business solutions that accomplish organizational goals.

defaultPosition.description:
Direct the work efforts of the division by establishing goals and objectives to formulate work plans supporting all program areas within the area of responsibility. 
Represent the Assistant Administrator and/or Deputy Assistant Administrator and ensuring overall compliance with applicable laws, rules, regulations, and policy requirements affecting broad acquisition management programs impacting strategic TSA goals and objectives. 
Provide innovative and expert leadership in the establishment and implementation of a comprehensive acquisition strategy that may accommodate areas such as new threats, new technologies, and changes in policy direction.
Collaborate with branch managers and staff to develop and implement effective acquisition strategies to meet operational needs. 
As subject matter expert and Division Director, works with other executives and program representatives to identify best acquisition options, ensuring vendor accountability, industry engagement, and resolves various and complex issues that arise in relation to product or service quality, operability, maintenance, scheduling impacts, and return on investment. 
Assess impact of the issue taking into account legal requirements, impact on operations, political implications, and options available. 
Manage budget formulation and building processes each year and ensuring the effective execution of annual budgets approved by Congress and allocated through appropriated programs. 
Approve budget allocations for travel, staff support, equipment and supplies. 
Identify staffing allocations and resources needed to execute the projects and programs within the Division's area of responsibility. 
Ensuring Branch managers are following the overall plan for mission success.
defaultPosition.title: Director

positions.title: Director

positions.description: As Assistant Director of Mission Support Washington, and in coordination with the Head Contracting Activity, the incumbent provides executive leadership, technical assistance and oversight in carrying out the functions of coordinating strategic acquisition initiatives with Program Directors within the ICE Office of the Director. Planning, developing, and directing the implementation of the comprehensive acquisition of firearms, ammunition, other munitions and related use of force equipment for all DHS law enforcement activities.
positions.title: Assistant Director

positions.description: Supervised two employee teams composed of contracting officers and contracting specialist within the Information Technology Commodities (ITC) division. Responsible for coordinating and managing contract operations for approved Information Technology (IT) for all ICE Program Offices. Provided expert advice to senior executive managers about but not limited to the planning, developing and establishing the conceptual strategy of the acquisition program.
positions.title: Deputy Assistant Director

positions.description: Served as a Contracting Officer with unlimited warrant authorized to solicit contractual proposals, negotiate, enter into, execute and administer/terminate the most complex and/or sensitive contracting projects for ICE. Directed the work of assigned staff and acted as a principal contracting advisor, and represented ICE as the principal contractual authority at conferences and meetings, with internal and external stakeholders.
positions.title: Senior Contract Specialist (Team Lead)

positions.description: Led team of analysts supporting federal government acquisition, grants and contracting activities in Top Secret environment. Performed research to conceptualize program acquisition strategy or innovative designs that maximized effectiveness and reduced the acquisition timeline. Performed management evaluations which dealt with policies, procedures, staffing, organization, information systems, productivity and interaction with internal and external customers.
positions.title: Senior Acquisition Analyst
